TopicTitle: Gargantua System (Lead by the remarkable Dr. Kaboom!)

Articles.Content:
So we have an Endurance mod, but no Gargantua. We have mountains, but they aren't waves as high as [the clouds!\[arrow-10x10.png\](http://cdncache-a.akamaihd.net/items/it/img/arrow-10x10.png)](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/). We have an ice planet (Eeloo, Vall is a moon) but no idiot to blow an airlock and make an intense scene. We have deserts, but no Wolf Edmunds. So, how will we get these things? Me, Dr. Kaboom (I'm not hijacking any ships and blowing out airlocks, unlike my colleague Dr. Mann) of course. 

So how will I do it? Space Engine (yes, I'm that guy), Kopernicus, and Kittopia Tech. Now, I'm sure a guy's [already!\[arrow-10x10.png\](http://cdncache-a.akamaihd.net/items/it/img/arrow-10x10.png)](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/) workin' on it, but he hasn't done a thing! Me, a kid with billions of years of free time, will get this thing out as soon as my procrastination side lets up, and I'm not going [shorts!\[arrow-10x10.png\](http://cdncache-a.akamaihd.net/items/it/img/arrow-10x10.png)](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/) shopping. 

Features Planned

Gargantua (No Neutron Star planned)

Miller's Planet 

Mann's Planet

Edmund's Planet

Don't believe me just watch!

[Update!\[arrow-10x10.png\](http://cdncache-a.akamaihd.net/items/it/img/arrow-10x10.png)](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/) 1: [Found!\[arrow-10x10.png\](http://cdncache-a.akamaihd.net/items/it/img/arrow-10x10.png)](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/) a perfect Miller's Planet! All oceans, no ice caps! Working on the config now! I don't know if you can export black hole textures, as I found one, and I'm sure you can, but I'm still

not sure. Experiment time!

Update 2: For those still [checking!\[arrow-10x10.png\](http://cdncache-a.akamaihd.net/items/it/img/arrow-10x10.png)](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/) this, Space Engine is messing around with me. I can't find an ice planet that matches Dr. Mann's planet perfectly. Also, it's glitching a little. Don't worry, I'm not giving up. I have found 3 Edmund candidates. I have a perfect Miller's Planet, as stated last update. I expect this to get a alpha release in the next few weeks after 1.0. Maybe sooner. I'll see what happens ;D.

Update 3: I'm working on the Gargantua config as of now. I will lose a few hours of time, but I expect to finish Gargantua tomorrow, and move on to Miller. You guys want it, so I'm working as fast as possible. I'm not giving up at all. Thanks for all your wonderful support. I promise this will get released.

Update 4: Forgot to save the Gargantua config last night. This is a small setback. I'm also taking a break for a few days, I plan to resume on Friday or Saturday. Don't worry, Just a small hiccup. I'm still keeping my promise.

Update 5: I found the Gargantua config deep into my computer, so no lost progress! I'm waiting to work on this until 1.0 releases. I'm not stopping everything, as I still need to find a Mann's Planet, so I'm not giving up. The reason for me waiting is bugs. If I release this thing when 1.0 still has the major bugs, It might break too, and I'm not taking any chances. THIS. WILL. GET. A. RELEASE. SOON. Don't worry!

If you just punch in your values into the ![gif.latex?%5Cinline%20%5Cfrac%7B2GM%7D%7Bc%5E%7B2%7D%7D](http://latex.codecogs.com/gif.latex?%5Cinline%20%5Cfrac%7B2GM%7D%7Bc%5E%7B2%7D%7D) equation (more info is on my mathematical equations page - link in sig) you'll get the radius needed. IIRC Gargantua is 100M sol masses, so you can go to the wiki page and get the Sun's mass and multiply it by 100 million and then substitute everything in. I'm out, and good luck!
